best_practices: Start with content and build design around it
Use whitespace as a design element, not empty space
Create clear visual hierarchy through size and weight
Limit decorative elements to enhance, not distract
Ensure accessibility through proper contrast ratios
common_mistakes: Low contrast text that's hard to read
Cluttered layouts with no visual breathing room

immediate: Audit current design for excessive elements
Reduce color palette to 3-5 colors maximum
medium_term: Improve focus states for interactive elements

approaches: Monochromatic schemes with one accent color
Duotone palettes with two complementary colors
High contrast text with neutral backgrounds
Strategic accent placement on interactive elements
color.description: Using limited, harmonious palettes that enhance rather than distract

layout.description: Creating structure and rhythm through consistent organization
principles: Use a 12-column grid system for flexibility
Apply the 8-point grid for consistent spacing
Create visual rhythm through consistent spacing units
Use alignment to create order and professionalism

typography.description: Creating clear hierarchy and visual rhythm through type
principles: Establish clear size hierarchy (major third scale recommended)
Use font weight for emphasis instead of multiple colors
Maintain consistent line heights (1.5-1.7 for body text)

benefits: Creates a sense of elegance and sophistication
Helps users focus on important content
whitespace.description: Strategic use of negative space to create visual breathing room
techniques: Use a consistent spacing system based on a base unit
Apply generous margins around content blocks
Create isolation between sections with vertical spacing
Use whitespace to guide the eye through the layout
